cab.content: [This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.]Printed for the War Cabinet. November 1917.SECRET.52WAR CABINET, 278.Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet, held at 10,.Downing Street, S.W.,on Tuesday, November 20, 1917, at 1L30 a.m.Present:The Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. the Earl Curzon of kedleston, ICC, CC.S.L, CC.I.E.The Right Hon. the Viscount Milner,CC.B., CC.M.CThe Right Hon. G. N. Barnes, M.P.The following wenThe Right Hon. A. J. Balfour, CM.,M.P., Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Lord Robert Cecil, ICC,M.P., Minister of Blockade.The Right Hon. Sir E. Geddes, G.B.E.,K.C.B., M.P., First Lord of the Ad-rairalty.Admiral Sir J. R. Jellicoe, G.C.B.,CM., G.C.V.O., First Sea Lord and chief of the Naval Staff.The Right Hon. the Earl of Derby,ICC, G.C.V.O., C.B., Secretary of Statefor War.General Sir W. R. Robertson, G.O.B.,K.C.V.O., D.S.O., Chief of the ImperialGeneral Staff.The Right Hon. W. Long, M.P., Secretaryof State for the Colonies.The Right Hon. Sir A. Stanley, M.P.,President of the Board of Trade.The Right Hon. Sir J. Maclay, Bart.,Shipping Controller.The Right Hon. Lord Rhondda, FoodController.Sir L. Worthington Evaxs, Bart., M.P.,Parliamentary Secretary, Ministiy ofMunitions.Major J. L. Baird, C.M.G., D.S.O., M.P.,Parliamentary Secretary, Air Board.The Right Hon. Austen Chamberlain,M.P.The Right Hon. A. Bonar Law, M.P.Lieutenant-General the Right Hon.J. 0. Smuts, ICC.The Right Hon. Sir Edward Carson,K.C., M.P.e also present :Admiral W. Shepherd Benson, Chief of operations, U.S. Navy.General Tasker Howard Bliss, Chief ofStaff, U.S. Army.Brigadier-General W. Lassiter, U.S.Army.Mr. Oscar Terry Crosby, assistant secretary of the Treasury.Mr. Vance C. McCormick, Chairman ofthe War Trade Board.Mr. Bainbridge Colby, Representative ofthe United States Shipping Board.Dr. Alonzo E. Taylor, RepresentingUnited States Food Controller.Mr. Thomas Nelson Perkins, Represen-tative of the United States War Indus-tries and Priority Board.Mr. Paul D. Cravath, Legal Adviser to united States Treasury.Mr. Gordon Auchincloss, AssistantCounsellor of the State department and Secretary to the American Mission.The Right Hon. the Viscount Reading,G.C.B., K.C.V.O.The Lord Northcliffe.Sir Charles Gordon, Vice-Chairman toLord Northcliffe's Mission.Lieutenant-Colonel Campbell Stuart,Military Secretary to Lord Northcliffe'mission.Mr. Philip Kerr.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M. P. A. Hankey, K.C.B., Secretary.Major L. Storr, Assistant Secretary.Colonel E. D. Swinton, C.B., D.S.O., Assistant Secretary.[1365--278] oneriean Mission: WITH reference to War Cabinet 275, Minute 6, the WarAmerican Cabinet and the beads of the Government Departments concernedCo-operation. conferred with certain members of the Mission from the U.b.A. nowin this country. . akt *The proceedings of the Meeting are printed m a separate WarCabinet Paper (I.C.-33)Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,November 20, 1917.
